intro: Medinilla hypericifolia, commonly known as the velvet tangerine or lantern plant, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from pink to white. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with glossy, dark green leaves. Its unique, lantern-like flower clusters make it a popular ornamental plant in tropical gardens. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
